newsitem.title: IRAN: Voting begins in Iran's presidential election. [CORRECTED 07:30 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Voting begins in Iran's presidential election. [CORRECTED 07:30 GMT]

text.p: Iranians began voting on Friday to replace President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, who must step down in August after eight years in office.
Supreme spiritual leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in remarks broadcast by Tehran radio, called on all eligible voters to take an active part in the election.
Some 33,180 polling stations guarded by 200,000 police opened for 10 hours (corrects from 12 hours) at 8:00 a.m. (0330 GMT). Thirty-three million Iranians aged 15 and over are eligible to vote.

The result looked set to be a close-fought contest between two Shi'ite Moslem clergymen, liberal-minded Mohammad Khatami and conservative Ali Akbar Nateq-Nouri. Two other candidates are standing but believed unlikely to make much impact.
